item.title: 最新消息：阿拉巴马州最高法院做出胚胎应被视为儿童的裁决后，阿拉巴马州总检察长不打算起诉体外受精提供者或家庭--该裁决使整个过程陷入混乱。
item.description:
BREAKING: Alabama's AG does not intend to prosecute in vitro fertilization providers or families in the wake of a state Supreme Court ruling that embryos should be considered children — a decision that has thrown the whole process into chaos. https://t.co/DiCf06d673 pic.twitter.com/OGTtauV2H8

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 最新消息：前总统特朗普打破了他对阿拉巴马州最高法院关于试管婴儿裁决的沉默，呼吁阿拉巴马州立法机构 "迅速采取行动"，保护获得治疗的机会。
item.description:
JUST IN: Former Pres. Trump breaks his silence on the Alabama Supreme Court ruling on IVF, calling on the Alabama legislature "to act quickly" to protect access to treatment.

Trump said he wants "to make it easier for mothers and fathers to have babies." https://t.co/L0hbhGzj2z

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 纳瓦尔尼的母亲要求警方对扣留其子遗体的调查人员提起刑事诉讼。周五，警方给了纳瓦尔尼的母亲 3 个小时的时间，让她同意举行私人葬礼，否则就告诉她纳瓦尔尼将被埋葬在他去世的监狱里。
item.description:
Navalny's mother asked police to open a criminal case against investigators who she says are withholding her son's body. On Friday, his mom was given 3 hours to agree to a private funeral or told that Navalny would be buried at the prison where he died. https://t.co/bPn8Mh9P0p

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 当局称，一名前殡仪馆老板被指控将一具女尸藏在灵车后面两年之久，并囤积了至少 30 人的火化遗骸，现已被捕。
item.description:
A former funeral home owner accused of hiding a woman's corpse in the back of a hearse for two years and hoarding the cremated remains of at least 30 people has been arrested, authorities said. https://t.co/RvMHSlvmq3

item.title: 研究人员说，他们在东南太平洋的一次考察中发现了 100 多个新物种。他们在智利海岸发现了深海珊瑚、玻璃海绵、海胆、片脚类动物、蹲龙虾等物种。
item.description:
Researchers say they discovered more than 100 new species during an expedition in the southeast Pacific.

They identified species including deep-sea corals, glass sponges, sea urchins, amphipods, squat lobsters, and others off the coast of Chile. https://t.co/H26TVoE7xI pic.twitter.com/qa0VB8IAb5

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: "她在自己家里，和一个应该保护她、关心她、爱她的男人在一起。调查此案的一名警探告诉 @abc2020 说："她当然不应该遭受如此残暴的对待。
item.description:
"She's in her own home, and she's with a man who is supposed to protect her, who's supposed to care for her, who's supposed to love her. And she certainly didn't deserve the brutality that she suffered," a detective who investigated the case told @abc2020. https://t.co/iQAvI5fXdj

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: "很多长期COVID症状......经常被写成'哦，那都是你的幻觉'，但这项研究表明了其背后的实际生物机制。"这项小型研究显示了一些长期COVID患者出现 "脑雾 "的可能原因。
item.description:
"A lot of long COVID symptoms ... are often written off as 'oh that’s all in your head' but this study is suggesting an actual biological mechanism behind it."

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024
